data.current_description: try to unpack the given file
data.summary_suggestion: Unpack executable file and extract contents
data.description_suggestion: Attempts to unpack the provided executable file using automated unpacking techniques. Accepts a file upload and processes it to extract packed content. Returns unpacking results including extracted data, unpacking method used, and success status. Uploaded files are temporarily stored during processing.

data.current_description: try to get the emulation output after unpacking the file
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve emulation output from unpacked executable
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the emulation output generated during the unpacking process of an executable file. Requires a previously unpacked file reference or file identifier. Returns emulation logs, system calls, memory access patterns, and behavioral analysis results captured during dynamic analysis. This operation depends on prior unpacking completion.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks clarity about prerequisites (requires prior unpacking), input requirements (file reference/ID), and output details (what emulation data is returned). data.summary_suggestion: Delete all uploaded and temporary files
data.description_suggestion: Removes all uploaded files and temporary data associated with the current session or specified file identifier. Permanently deletes unpacked content, emulation outputs, and intermediate processing files from the server. This operation frees server resources and cannot be undone. Returns confirmation of deletion with count of removed files.

data.current_description: generate partial YARA rules for give executable. (Rule without the condition section)
data.summary_suggestion: Generate partial YARA detection rules for executable
data.description_suggestion: Generates partial YARA rules for the provided executable file, excluding the condition section. Accepts an executable file or file identifier as input. Returns YARA rule patterns, string definitions, and metadata sections that can be used as templates for malware detection. The generated rules require manual addition of condition logic for complete functionality. Useful for creating custom detection signatures.

data.current_description: apply given YARA rules to the given executable. (upto 10 rules)
data.summary_suggestion: Apply YARA rules to scan executable file
data.description_suggestion: Applies up to 10 YARA detection rules against the provided executable file to identify patterns and potential malware signatures. Accepts an executable file and an array of YARA rule definitions as input. Returns matching rule results including rule names, matched strings, offsets, and severity indicators. Supports batch rule evaluation in a single operation. Useful for malware classification and threat detection.
